title: Clarifying Key Concepts
text: To identify data that can justify a decision, it's crucial to start with asking fundamental questions. These questions help define what is truly needed to support an argument or perspective.

title: Understanding 'Fundamental Questions'
text: Fundamental questions' are queries that go to the essence of the decision-making process. They might include questions like: What is the primary objective? What data is available and reliable? What are the possible outcomes of different actions?

title: Exploring Examples of Fundamental Questions
text: Consider the decision to implement a new work policy. An example of fundamental questions could be: 'What are the costs and benefits of the new policy?' and 'How will the policy impact employee productivity?'
